properties.name: An Spideal/Spiddal
properties.description: Posted by Alexia Quaint Gaeltacht (Irish speaking) town located in Connemara. Famous town landmarks include the Crafts Centre and The Cruiscin Lan (or the Full Jug) Hotel. Most of the people in this town speak Irish as their first language. The Irish television soap-opera, Ros na Run is filmed here.

properties.name: Angela's Ashes Film Location
properties.description: Posted by Alexia The makers of Angela\'s Ashes filmed here. They whole quay was shut down and dressed as it was during the 1930s/1940s.

properties.name: Bistro Bianconi
properties.description: Posted by AlexiaBest pizza takeaway on the South-side

properties.name: Bobby Byrne's Pub
properties.description: Posted by AlexiaScene of many a gang get together. Relaxed, traditional sporting pub.

properties.name: Boher
properties.description: Posted by Alexia Small blink-and-you\'ll miss it village on the Ballysimon Rd. nestled between Limerick City and Tipperary. Has two small fantastic pubs right next to each other O\'Neill\'s (I think) and McCarthy\'s. McCarthy\'s is my personal favourite - 4 small tables and a turf fire in a nook - real Irish pub. Only fits about 10 punters at a time!

properties.name: Celje
properties.description: Posted by Alexia   Regional city in Slovenia with impressive Roman heritage. Wonderful restaurants, historical buildings and great beer. A hidden charm in North Central Slovenia.

properties.name: Chester
properties.description: Posted by Alexia  One of the nicest cities I\'ve visited. Had funny experience of seeing my first Gap store (yes, I live a sheltered life) in a city famed for it\'s Roman heritage. Soap opera Family Affairs is apparently set here.

properties.name: Chicken Hut
properties.description: Posted by Alexia Best Southern Fried Chicken restaurant open after the nightclubs close!

properties.name: Colbert Train Station & Limerick Bus Station
properties.description: Posted by AlexiaRestored Victorian building that serves as the central hub of train and bus services into and out of Limerick

properties.name: Dublin Zoo
properties.description: Posted by Alexia

properties.name: Intel Lab AKA Jim's Home
properties.description: Posted by AlexiaHome of the MENGCOMPSYS 06 Gang - ACTUAL home of one crank called Jim. Crazed and brandishing filed bananas, he lives in the corners. Snooping and ~~~~~~~>~~~~~~~

properties.name: Kenmare
properties.description: Posted by AlexiaCharming Kerry tourist town. Much nicer than Killarney. Loads of pubs here. My friends Scott and Rogier hail from Kenmare by way of England and the Neatherlands.

properties.name: King John's Castle
properties.description: Posted by Alexia10th Century castle and former mint. Recently restored. Concerts and events held here during the summer.

properties.name: Lansdowne Road
properties.description: Posted by Alexia Home of Irish Rugby and Rep of Ireland Soccer

properties.name: LeisurePlex 24 Hr Bowling
properties.description: Posted by AlexiaSays it all in the title. Apparently, they do Quazar there too.

properties.name: Limerick Institute of Technology
properties.description: Posted by AlexiaLimerick Third-Level Institution. Formerly known as Limerick Regional Technical College. Has developed a lot over the past 10 years. Did my primary degree here.

properties.name: Marlay Park
properties.description: Posted by Alexia Popular outside south Dublin concert venue. Dido played here.

properties.name: Morton's Gourmet Supermarket
properties.description: Posted by AlexiaMy favourite supermarket in the Ranelagh/Rathmines area. Has a nice delicatessan and open to 8pm Mon-Fri, 7pm Sat and from 11am-4pm Sun.

properties.name: Mungret
properties.description: Posted by Alexia Small village outside of Limerick City where I grew up

properties.name: Peig Sayers' Island
properties.description: Posted by Alexia Peig Sayers was a living legend. Some people decry her as a bitter old woman who complained about life but without her the oral tradition of Irish storytelling would be dead. Her autobiography captured life as an Islander just before the 20th century wiped out these traditions. Peig is a good read. (Please note, I\'m not exactly sure where her house is located - so do some extra research or ask some locals before setting off to see it!)

properties.name: Plas Menai Watersports Centre
properties.description: Posted by AlexiaWelsh watersports site. Going there in June.

properties.name: Ranelagh Organic Market
properties.description: Posted by Alexia   Every Sunday afternoon an organic farmers market is held in Ranelagh\'s Interdemonational School

properties.name: Red Cow Roundabout
properties.description: Posted by AlexiaAffectionately dubbed the "Mad Cow Roundabout". Heart of Dublin Commuters compliants. Red Luas line passes through it.

properties.name: Salthill Strand
properties.description: Posted by AlexiaOne of my favourite beach spots. Lots of gloriously garish amusement places nearby. Traditional beach getaway.

properties.name: Sara's BBQ
properties.description: Posted by AlexiaSara\'s BBQMidsommerfest Party! Hola Svenska

properties.name: Smartinsko Jezero
properties.description: Posted by AlexiaArtifical lake originally created as a reservoir designed to support the industrial aspirations of the Former Yugoslavia. Economic downturn left the lakes unused. Now being developed as a leisure spot just outside the urban mass of Celje. Pleasure boat rides occur every Sunday on old-style propellor-type showboats. Numerous family-style pubs about the place. Fishermans\' and hunters huts. Riding school also located on the shores of the lake. Smartinsko Jezero stands for St. Martin\'s Reservoir, with the name St. Martin\'s coming from a nearby village called Smartno v Rozni dolini or St. Martin\'s of the Rose Valley.

properties.name: The Orchard Bar
properties.description: Posted by Alexia Traditional thatch bar from outside, trendy cafebar inside. Good food and nice company

properties.name: Treaty Stone
properties.description: Posted by AlexiaThe stone on which the Treaty of Limerick was signed. Was originally a stone to help riders mount their horses.
